turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Voodoo.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I told you.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: You've got all these theories but where is he? Where? Where's your fisherman killer?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: You never do...The guy at the nightclub, the body in your room last night. Little notes that only mean something to you. How do we even know you're not the one behind this --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Don't kill me --

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Wait, it's Nancy --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Julie! Wait! You okay?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You sure?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You don't seem fine.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The shower again?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It was in a church...it was so real. I mean, I could feel his breath on me.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I thought I was over the dreams for good. I really did. I hadn't had one for months.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It just takes time, Julie. It's gonna get better.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It can't get worse. I mean, it's not like this was the first time I freaked out in class. I hardly ever get a full night's sleep, my grades suck, I'm this close from being thrown out of school.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It was one year ago...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's...the anniversary. That's what's going on...Take it easy on yourself.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm trying. I really am...Sometimes I don't even know why I came up here in the first place.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: To get out of Southport?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Right. Now I remember.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Nah. I'll probably just be here studying for finals. The joys of summer school...  Are you okay?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I'm okay.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Are you sure?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: This was not my idea.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I said, this...Do you want a drink?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Just take deep breaths and think of something happy from childhood.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What if I don't have anything happy from childhood...Sorry, I can't relax going five hundred miles an hour, or four thousand, four hundred feet a minute...  Which is over seven hundred feet a second. Imagine hitting something at seven hundred feet a second.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Deep breaths --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Fumes build up in the fuel tanks. You can by surface-to-air missiles over the internet. Planes use O-rings...which freeze in tap water. Planes fall from the sky for practically no reason at all.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: You've got a better chance of getting hit by lightning.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Right. Planes get hit by lightning. They get hit by meteors. They hit other planes.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: And it's been blue skies all day. It might be perfect all weekend.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It beets being on the mainland.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You sure it's okay with you?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Sure. It's fine. As long as you don't snore.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You can toss a shoe at me if it gets out of hand.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Julie? What's wrong?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's...him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What do you mean, Julie?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He did something to the screen...it, it, said...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Oh, Will! I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's my fault. I shouldn't have...I didn't think...

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No, no, no. This was really sweet...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I scared you -- I crossed the line --

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: No -- it's not that. It's...I'm just a little on edge. I'm really sorry.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Hey, you don't have to appologize to me. I'm the one. I understand.  I'm going to take a walk and dry off.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Are you sure? I really appreciate it.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What? What are you talking about? Where?

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: It's in my room!

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: There was a body! I swear it!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Julie, you said you were tired. Waybe you were dreaming.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I wasn't dreaming.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Come on. We're gonna be okay.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Did you get help?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Estes came after me with a gaffing hook.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: He's in it with Willis?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I guess so.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Me, me, me. It's always about you. I'm having bad dreams. I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in school. I'm having trouble with my boyfriend.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: I trusted you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We had a connection, didn't we? I can tell you one thing, though. Ray didn't trust me. He was right. He's dead, but he was right.

turns.speaker: JULIE
turns.text: ...Why?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why? Come on, Julie. Think. You'll get it. Will Benson -- Ben's son.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: You know what I want to do to you ...right now, don't you? There's gotta be somewhere we can be alone.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I don't think so. It's pretty crowded.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Just for a minute, baby. I got something I wanna tell you.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: If you can say all you gotta say in a minute then I don't wanna hear it.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'll talk real slow.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Worse comes to worse, you can stand there and watch me.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Come on, I'll take a break and we'll all dance.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Is there a problem here?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Where there's a Will, there's a way. Come on.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Something is gonna hit your butt if you don't quit complaining.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Honey, some folks just can't fly.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Ain't nothin' free in this world. Everybody says it, and it's true.  I wanted you all to have a good trip.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: We will, baby...All this means is we got the whole island to ourselves.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Oooh, the mainland --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Somebody's gone tropical on us, baby. Tropical!

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Guess the capital of Brazil --

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Rio, baby!

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Pretty cool bar.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: They all start to look the same once you've worked in one.  Am I right, sister?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Tha's it.  I've decided.  I'm changing my major to finance.  And going to Wall Street.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: 'Cause that's the only way I'm ever gonna be able to afford a big bed like this.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: You sure you didn't pick up my hair tie?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Hello?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Okay, I just didn't wanna get my hair wet.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Baby, I finally got you alone in this Jacuzzi and I don't wanna be discussin' hair care.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I used to be a lifeguard...I'd hate to have to blow my whistle.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'd hate for you to have to blow...your whistle.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Oh, look. Another day in paradise with Julie-your-tour-director...Miss Psychotic Episode.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Hey --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: See any dead bodies out there? Any fresh kill? How 'bout Freddy, Jason?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Somebody...is a sick, fingerpainting psycho.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: We gotta get out of here. Now.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'll come with you.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Are you crazy? We're not staying here on our own.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Maybe we should just wait here? Hide in a tree?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'm not hiding up no tree.  I'm with her. Let's arm ourselves to the teeth and kick this psycho's butt.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: You think that's a good place to hide?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I don't know, but I'm starving.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Julie, is everything cool? Karla said...

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: I said we start having fun. And that means now.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: To a great weekend --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Yeah, a great weekend. Forget the weather!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Come on, it'll be fun.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Ladies and gentlemen, please put your hands together for my friend, my very best friend, Julie James.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Ahh, that feels great.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: How's Julie?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Alone. In the room.  Got any advise?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Why? He can't help us.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He's probably the only one who can help us.

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Mark in the Morning! Magic 96.7! Oh my God! I'm Karla. Karla Wilson.  Jules, it's Mark in the Morning.

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Well, Karla, what're you doin' at home over the long fourth weekend?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Well, I'm in school and --

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: How'd you like to win a Magic 96.7 Quicky Getaway?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Still here...thinking...  You mean Brazil, the country?

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Okay, Karla, five seconds.  Five...Four...

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Rio de Janeiro!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: Oh, no...Did you say Rio?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: No. Yes?

turns.speaker: KARLA
turns.text: Waaaaahhhhhhhhhh!

turns.speaker: MARK
turns.text: We'll call you back with all the details...So what's your favorite radio station?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Jeez, that's a full carat --

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Well, there's some flaws in her...

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Don't really have the market for something like this...  I can go two...two-fifty.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: Make it three hundred. And throw that in, too.

turns.speaker: MAC
turns.text: Hell, that's worth three, easy. And you got your waiting period.

turns.speaker: RAY
turns.text: I'm not waiting...So give me the gun and keep the ring.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You guys lost?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Tell me this ain't the bar scene.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Wanna drink?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: What's the matter, boy trouble?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Not anymore.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: He leave you?

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: No. I shot him.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Julie thinks there's a dead guy in the closet.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Cool.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: The rest of us see bathrobes.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: I'm sorry, but you could've been the one doing all of this --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: And so could you -- crazy fool.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: You stumbled into my hiding place.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Must have missed the sign.

turns.speaker: NANCY
turns.text: Excuse me, but this island didn't have a murder rate until you people showed up.  I've never seen a dead body before.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Can't talk right now.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: See, it's not a macho thing. It's about equilibrium in your inner ear. You could've used a patch, but it's too late now. Get used to it.  Some folks just can't sail.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We didn't get all dressed up for nothing.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Planter's Punch, Singapore Sling, or how about a Mai-Tai?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: The last day of the season. Yeah, we heard.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: So why are you still here?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: There's ten people on this whole island and they're all gonna end up in this Jacuzzi with us.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How's the water?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Crowded.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: I'm just saying what all of you are thinking. It's bad enough gettin' rained out without having to hold her hand the whole time.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You don't have to be a jerk.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Where is everybody?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: They're all dead...Dead, I tell you.  Ahhhh, we're all deaaaddddd. Tyrellll, joinnnn usss.

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: They're around...They just don't care about us 'cause we're the contest winners.  Let's go find Stoner Boy...Make his lazy butt hook us up with fishing poles or Ping-Pong paddles or something.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You know, the greenhouse effect has caused the gulf stream to shift and almost every meteorological expert expects a dramatic increase in tropical depression --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Hey -- shut up, okay?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Take this.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: And do what with it?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: They were cut loose.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Julie? Wanna tell us what is going on here?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: The porter...what's his name? Old Asbestos --

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Estes! That's exactly who it is. That old guy knows something. We can sit here and wait for him to pick us off or we can go find him first.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We'll only be a second, okay?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: Yeah, wait right here, it's the safest place.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Where'd Estes go?

turns.speaker: TYRELL
turns.text: What is up with that weirdo?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'll go find him.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: You don't have to. It's inside of you -- all the glory that was Greece - the dancing, the singing and the white marble --

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: How clover you are, Mr. Albrecht, to see all that in our simple Thea... She is quite pretty, isn't she?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: This was the temple of Hades --the God of the Dead. It contained no images -- just empty space and walls of perfect symmetry.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: How disappointing! I expected it was something more romantic. A temple to the Goddess of Love, perhaps.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: The Greeks thought death was beautiful -- an adventure --a journey to another world.  But I have my other guests to think of -- The General will be wanting to go back to his army. If you'll excuse me --

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Where is Miss Wollsten?

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: She's in her room.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I took it for granted you gentlemen were refugees as are my other guests.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: This is General Nikolas Pherides, Commander of the Third Army. I'm Oliver Davis.  To be perfectly frank with you, we didn't expect to find anyone living here.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: It is my home.  My name is Hugo Albrecht.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: But the gods played a little trick on me. I was born in Switzerland.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: You collect these to sell, abroad?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: He is exhausted.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Why don't you stay here tonight? Get a good sleep. You can return to your command in the morning.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I need your advice  something has happened  Mr.  Jacks 

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Drunk again?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: He's dead. I want the General to see him.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: He complained of not feeling well. I thought he was drunk 	he staggered.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: That staggering. His dying so quickly.  In your campaigns, have you never seen men who staggered before they died, who talked incoherently  walked blindly.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I wonder if my editor's psychic? Reports from the Greek front are going to be a little vague.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Or even spirit messages from the next world.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'd like to, very much -- but it depends on what dispatches are waiting for me on the mainland.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: In case you do so, would you --

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: It doesn't look much like the fish spears I knew back in Marblehead..

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Our friend, Poseidon, didn't use it for fishing. He raked the sea with it and stirred up the big waves.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I'll go up and take a look at the General - perhaps sit with him.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: He won't even know you're there. He is delirious.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: All the more reason to watch him. He's had some wild notions lately.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Don't bother. Go to bed and get some sleep. I'll be working late.  I can hear any movement down here.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Well 

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Go ahead. I'll wake you up when I go to bed. Then you can watch him.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Thank you, I'll do that. Good night.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: May life be good to you both. As for the others  they will be quiet here  and I will be with them.

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: If the wind shifts, if the sirocco blows -- the hot wind from the South -- all danger will be over in twenty-four hours.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Good winds and bad winds!

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: The ancient Greeks had just as good an explanation -- that the gods sent the plague to punish mortals for harboring Vrykolaka --

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: They used to believe that sort of thing in the mountain villages. Some still do --

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: She's right. This is hardly the time to bandy old tales.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I have lived long enough to doubt everything -- which is to say, I believe everything, a little.

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: You're just talking nonsense.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Let us put it to the test. Protect yourself with every scientific precaution you can think of. I'll go out on the cliff and build a votive fire to Hermes -- not that I believe in him any more than I do in Science.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: We will see who is the first to die.

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: Very well. I'll wager a dinner.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I suppose you want to hear my prayer to Hermes.

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: I just came to see if your prayer would entertain me as much as my medicine seems to amuse you.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: ) You feel the symptoms?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: My friend -- what can one say --

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: You can have your servants prepare a dinner. That is the way I'll meet my old- familiar enemy -- Death --I have fought him before. I've won often. Now he wins. Let him come for me at my own banquet.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'm here. The General is here. You are not alone.

turns.speaker: DR. DROSSOS
turns.text: I must meet him with laughter - with songs and laughter -- to show him I am not afraid --

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: I have not been on the island in twenty years. It is changed - changed completely. Where are the graves -- the coffins?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: This was once a cemetery.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: The enemy is in retreat. There will be no more fighting here.  I came here to visit the crypts. My wife was buried here. What happened to the bodies?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: They were gore before I came here.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: But why?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: There was some trouble here the villagers on the mainland -this island was the focal point of their anger. They came here broke open the tombs and despoiled the graves.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: All the graves?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'm afraid so. There were rumors people were aroused. Some feared restlessness among the dead you know, the old superstitions.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: I donut understand.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Perhaps I had better stay. I am tired.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'll get Ida to make up your bed.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: I'm not sure that it is the plague.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: We will know when the next one sickens.  Until then you and I remain here. I will not bring the plague to my troops.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: In the meantime it would be useless to alarm the others.  Let them think it was a normal  And, perhaps it was - perhaps it was.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Did you hear what Thea said -- as if she knew what threatens us.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: That's impossible. I told them Jacks died of a sudden heart attack, probably brought on by over drinking.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: Did your servant got word to Dr. Drossos?

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Another sad task. We'll bury her tomorrow.  I think we'd better lock the door for tonight. It will make them less uncomfortable.

turns.speaker: GENERAL
turns.text: No.  She shall not be left here.

turns.speaker: ALBRECHT
turns.text: Maybe you're right. Help me get something to carry her downstairs.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: You were singing, weren't you? A beautiful voice, Miss St. Aubyn.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: That was my companion. She sings little peasant songs quite nicely -- a completely untrained voice, of course.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I hope Mr. Jacks gets to bed in one piece.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: M~ father will take care of it.  Pappa is wonderful! No matter what happens, he makes me feel perfectly safe.  I could never leave him. I should be utterly helpless by myself.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: I adore hearing Thea sing -- but my poor head's beginning to ache.  I'm so sorry.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Of course. Tomorrow, perhaps, before I go?

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: I'm glad you and the General didn't have to leave us. We would feel quite deserted..

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: How could we go back to the wars with such pleasant company here..

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: Good night, Oliver.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Sleep well.

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: You're not leaving tomorrow..?

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I think not.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: I know it must be hard. But you have relatives in London --you've got a whole world of living, ahead of you --

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: No one can take my father's place.

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: Where's Thea?

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: I think she went to bed  I saw her going toward the house

turns.speaker: CATHY
turns.text: Oh, no - it's too delicious! You're making it up!

turns.speaker: OLIVER
turns.text: On my word! That's what they believe.
